alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 4:41AM AKST until February 22 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 3 PM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, blowing snow, and drifting snow expected. Plan on very difficult travel conditions in localized blizzard conditions. Visibility will be near zero at times. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches, with localized amounts up to 23 inches, are expected. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range south of Trims Camp and west of the Tok Cutoff. * WHEN...Noon today to 3 PM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 75 mph will cause areas of significant blowing and drifting snow. Large snow drifts will form. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow and blowing snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
